001package com.technototes.library.hardware2;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DigitalChannel;
004
005/**
006 * TODO: Remove this. I don't believe this adds much value. Yeah, HardwareMap.get is weird, but
007 * it's in all the documentation, so just read it, see it in the examples, and you're done.
008 */
009public class DigitalBuilder extends HardwareBuilder<DigitalChannel> {
010
011    /**
012     * Don't use this in the future
013     *
014     * @param name undoc
015     */
016    public DigitalBuilder(String name) {
017        super(name);
018    }
019
020    /**
021     * Don't use this in the future
022     *
023     * @param device undoc
024     */
025    public DigitalBuilder(DigitalChannel device) {
026        super(device);
027    }
028
029    /**
030     * Don't use this in the future
031     *
032     * @param port undoc
033     */
034    public DigitalBuilder(int port) {
035        super(port);
036    }
037
038    /**
039     * Don't use this in the future
040     *
041     * @param mode undoc
042     * @return undoc
043     */
044    public DigitalBuilder mode(DigitalChannel.Mode mode) {
045        product.setMode(mode);
046        return this;
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Don't use this in the future
051     *
052     * @return undoc
053     */
054    public DigitalBuilder input() {
055        return mode(DigitalChannel.Mode.INPUT);
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Don't use this in the future
060     *
061     * @return undoc
062     */
063    public DigitalBuilder output() {
064        return mode(DigitalChannel.Mode.OUTPUT);
065    }
066}
